filteredArticles.headline: Angelina Eimannsberger | Let’s validate each other during isolation
filteredArticles.subhead: The Feminist Minute | ‘I see you and I love you’ instead of ‘Oh, I didn’t think about that’
filteredArticles.abstract: It’s key to keep an open mind and listen carefully, even if it's virtually, to what everyone around you is experiencing.

filteredArticles.headline: Penn Med study shows financial incentive can help physicians receive opioid training
filteredArticles.abstract: After receiving the training, the study found that 65% of physicians reported administering or prescribing the treatment within five months.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Penn study finds political beliefs affected how Americans followed distancing guidelines

Penn study finds that speech can transmit viruses

dominantMedia.title: Penn Medicine.jpg
dominantMedia.content: A Penn Medicine study found that financial incentive would encourage 89% of physicians to get proper training to administer buprenorphine.

filteredArticles.headline: University of California will end use of SAT, ACT in admissions entirely by fall 2025
filteredArticles.abstract: Brian Taylor, managing director of New York City-based college admissions consulting firm Ivy Coach, believes the decision will influence other universities, and said it is likely that highly selective universities, such as Ivy League institutions, will be test-optional in the future.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Here’s how Ivy League universities are changing testing requirements for the Class of 2025

filteredArticles.headline: New Wharton initiative will introduce students to the world of artificial intelligence
filteredArticles.abstract: The program aims to inspire teaching and research in the field of AI and will be led by professor Kartik Hosanagar.

filteredArticles.headline: Africana Studies and English prof. Herman Beavers appointed Civic House faculty director
filteredArticles.abstract: Beavers will succeed Walter H. Annenberg Professor of History Walter Licht, who served as the Civic House faculty director since 2002, and the founder of its Civic Scholars program.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

History prof. Walter Licht will step down as Civic House faculty director in June

Vice Provost for University Life will leave position for new student engagement role

dominantMedia.title: Herman Beavers.JPG
dominantMedia.content: As the new faculty director of Civic House and the Civic Scholars program, Beavers seeks to create mutually beneficial, non-exploitative relationships with the West Philadelphia community.

filteredArticles.headline: University's retrieval policy draws mixed reactions from on-campus residents
filteredArticles.abstract: Some students, having been unable to retrieve belongings from their dorms for months, are frustrated by Penn Residential Services’ recently announced procedures for letting students retrieve, store, or ship their items.

dominantMedia.title: Move Out Penn Residential Services.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Students who have not moved out from the College Houses may return to campus between June 4 and June 13 to retrieve their belongings, or have their items packed and stored at no cost.

filteredArticles.headline: Wharton coronavirus course taken by over 2,400 people deemed a success by students, faculty
filteredArticles.abstract: Guest lecturers included Penn President Amy Gutmann, National Bureau of Economic Research Fellow Kent Smetters, and Wharton Dean Geoffrey Garrett, among others.
filteredArticles.infobox:
RELATED:

Gutmann criticizes U.S. for ‘striking lack’ of global leadership during coronavirus course

dominantMedia.title: Wharton Coronavirus Class Mauro Guillen Geoffrey Garrett Final.jpg
dominantMedia.content: Professor Mauro Guillén spoke with guest lecturer and Wharton Dean Geoffrey Garrett on April 29, the final session of the course.

filteredArticles.headline: Nursing students worry missed clinical hours, online replacements leave them underprepared
filteredArticles.abstract: Although Nursing students were initially told they could continue their clinical rotations, the School of Nursing announced on March 13 that Penn Medicine and its affiliates placed an indefinite hold on clinical placements at their facilities.
